miic3.utils.datatype.Unit¶

class miic3.utils.datatype.Unit(numerator=['1'], denominator=['1'])[source]¶

Represent the unit of a physical quantity

Class to handle the unit of a physical quantity.

Parameters

  • numerator (list of strings) – units in the numerator as list of strings that may contain a prefix e.g. [‘kg’,’m’]

  • denominator (list of strings) – units in the denominator as list of strings that may contain a prefix e.g. [‘s’,’s’]

Supported Operations

unit = unitA + unitB

Raises an error if units do not match. See also Unit.__add__() and Unit.__sub__().

unit = unitA * unitB

Returns the procuct of two units. See also Unit.__mul__() and Unit.__truediv__().

unit = unitA**N

Returns the power of a unit for an interger N. See also Unit.__pow__().

str(unit)

Returns a string representation of the unit.

__init__(numerator=['1'], denominator=['1'])[source]¶

Methods

__init__([numerator, denominator])

copy()

Make a copy of the unit object.

load(filename)

Load an unit object from a numpy npz file.

save(filename)

Save the object in a numpy npz file
